intro: Scelochilus janeae, commonly known as the Jane's scelochilus, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its unique and delicate floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually small and come in a range of colors, including white, pink, and purple, making it a visually striking species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Scelochilus janeae is considered a species of conservation concern.
